body:
What would be really helpful is if you could `kill -QUIT` rclone when it gets stuck. I think `killall -QUIT rclone` should work if issued from another terminal window (sorry not a mac user!).

This should generate a traceback - if you could post the entire thing here then I can work out what is going on.

Thanks.

```

2020/10/13 15:37:19 Failed to create file system for "jottacloud-crypt:archives/2019-01/home/": failed to make remote "jottacloud:/data/" to wrap: couldn't get customer info: Get "https://api.jottacloud.com/account/v1/customer": couldn't fetch token - maybe it has expired? - refresh with "rclone config reconnect jottacloud:": oauth2: cannot fetch token: 400 Bad Request
Response: {"error":"invalid_grant","error_description":"Stale token"}
```

The final log entry was from the /next/ rclone operation that had been run I was running them in a loop to handle 2019-03, 2019-02, and 2019-01. 2019-02 was the one that was stuck, and which I issued the -QUIT to. It exited and the loop contined on to the 01, where it reported that error. I don't know if that's a relevant error though. In the other runs I've done even when it completed the token was still valid.

However, trying it now with an `lsd` I do get that error:

```
rclone -v lsd --checkers 15 --transfers 25 jottacloud-crypt:archives/2019-03/home/charles/music
2020/10/13 15:42:27 Failed to create file system for "jottacloud-crypt:archives/2019-03/home/charles/music": failed to make remote "jottacloud:/data/" to wrap: couldn't get customer info: Get "https://api.jottacloud.com/account/v1/customer": couldn't fetch token - maybe it has expired? - refresh with "rclone config reconnect jottacloud:": oauth2: cannot fetch token: 400 Bad Request
Response: {"error":"invalid_grant","error_description":"Stale token"}
```

I hope something in that is useful to you - I'll go get a new token and try the sync again :-)

In the traceback, rclone is trying to refresh the token. Everything else looks absolutely normal.

Can you try again and see if you can replicate the problem and post the traceback again.

It would be worth running with -vv and uploading the log too - rclone will be printing stuff about renewing the token...

Thanks

Interesting; the next transfer I go through, I'll add a -vv option and then I may have more info for you - I'm transferring backups from the hubic provider to jottacloud, so I've got quite a few more transfers still to do.

I presume -vv will include data I'll need to obscure otherwise it'll give away secrets? Is there an easy way to spot what needs obscuring?

I ran a transfer with -vv and I can now see the long period where the number of files reported is unchanging, and can see that the traffic is very low, BUT with -vv in the list I can now see what it's doing.

```
Transferred:   	         0 / 0 Bytes, -, 0 Bytes/s, ETA -
Checks:            168098 / 168098, 100%
Elapsed time:    3h38m5.8s

2020/10/13 21:20:06 DEBUG : charles/.indent.pro: Removing directory
2020/10/13 21:20:10 DEBUG : charles/.cpanm/work/1584575198.11594: Removing directory
2020/10/13 21:20:13 DEBUG : charles/.cpanm/work/1584575178.10998: Removing directory
2020/10/13 21:20:16 DEBUG : charles/.cpanm/work/1584574184.8584: Removing directory
2020/10/13 21:20:18 DEBUG : charles/.cpanm/work/1584573965.8022: Removing directory
2020/10/13 21:20:22 DEBUG : charles/.cpanm/work/1584573940.7434: Removing directory
2020/10/13 21:20:25 DEBUG : charles/.cpanm/work/1584572852.4411: Removing directory
2020/10/13 21:20:27 DEBUG : charles/.cpanm/work/1584572828.3873: Removing directory
... and so on ...
```

As you can see, it /is/ doing something... once every 2 to 3 seconds it's deleting a directory. And that's probably why it's taking so long, and appears to be doing nothing. There doesn't seem to be a configuration for the number of deleter jobs (--transfers and --checkers, I have both set to 15), and maybe it's using the --transfers flag but it really is just taking a long time and every 3 seconds one of those requests completes.

It'd be nice to have some feedback that it's actually achieving something during that period when it's deleting directories, though.

I've had the -vv switch enabled for the past few days doing the copy, and it's looking like it is always doing something during that seemingly idle period at the end - it's just deleting the directories, as noticed in the prior comment. Because there's no feedback in the statistics of what it's doing, that looked like it was stuck when it really was doing things. In my case I think I had exacerbated the problem because of how I was doing the copy.

I would `copy` from hubic->jottacloud one set of backups for a month. This would download the content to my machine and then upload to jottacloud, so it's pretty tedious. Then I would do a jottacloud->jottacloud `copy` to copy that backup to the previous months. This would do a server side copy, so all those files would be copied really quickly and there would be no need for anything other than the control operations. Then I would do a `sync` from hubc->jottacloud the actual backups for those months.

Because I'm going backwards in time, this resulted in (mostly) deleting files that weren't present and restoring them to the older versions. The further back in time I went with my copy of the monthly backups, the greater the differences and the greater the number of files and directories to be deleted. For one of the backups, there were 310K files checked, 120K files deleted, and 43K directories deleted - and those directory deletions took a long time for each individual one, as mentioned.

```
2020/10/16 13:35:00 DEBUG : Encrypted drive 'jottacloud-crypt:archives/2018-11/home/': failed to delete 2 directories
2020/10/16 13:35:00 DEBUG : Encrypted drive 'jottacloud-crypt:archives/2018-11/home/': deleted 43381 directories
2020/10/16 13:35:00 ERROR : Attempt 2/3 succeeded
2020/10/16 13:35:00 INFO  : 
Transferred:   	    6.504M / 6.504 MBytes, 100%, 371 Bytes/s, ETA 0s
Checks:            311611 / 311611, 100%
Deleted:           121115
Transferred:          909 / 909, 100%
Elapsed time:   21h42m3.4s
```

So that's the reason it appeared to be stuck at the end of the run - it was doing the directory deletions, but there was no indication of its progress.

OK, so a stat "Deleted dirs:" would work for you ? Maybe I could add it after the Deleted: line so it said something like this?

    Deleted:           121115 (files), 1234 (dirs)

It is annoying when things hang and they don't tell you what they are doing, but it is also annoying if I put too many stats in!

That would be really cute; I do understand the hassle of wiring those things up so that they report through to the right place, too.

Whatever works for you. At the moment I'm using -vv all the time because it ensures that I understand that it really is doing something during that end phase, as the deletes turn up there. So you could argue that there's sufficient information if people want it - they just have to up the verbosity.

Have a go with this and tell me what you think :-)

[v1.54.0-beta.4849.48e5ff82f.fix-stats](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-stats/v1.54.0-beta.4849.48e5ff82f.fix-stats/) on branch [fix-stats](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-stats) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)
Kicked off a sync... I'll let you know how it goes, ta!

Yup; I've just been watching some of the transfers at the end, and I can see that it is doing things.

I'm now getting INFO reports that look like this, and it makes it a lot clearer:

```
2019-W40: 2020/10/29 11:11:45 INFO  :

2019-W40: 
```
I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) in 15-30 mins and released in v1.54 :-)
